name: section_break_globish_event_calendar
description: This section is powered by the Globish Event Calendar custom application. All functions—except for the JSON filters—utilize functionalities from FullCalendar.io. For a detailed explanation of each function, please visit the FullCalendar.io website.
label: Globish Event Calendar Settings

name: custom_scrolltime
description: Allow calendar to automatically scrolls to the current time (minus 30 minutes) on load; otherwise, it defaults to the 'Earliest Display Time' or the start of the day.
label: Enable Auto-Scroll to Current Time

name: custom_sloteventoverlap
description: Allow events in Week and Day views (Time Grid) to visually overlap if they occur at the same time. (slotEventOverlap)
label: Allow Event Slots to Overlap

name: custom_scrolltimereset
description: Automatically reset its vertical scroll position (based on your 'Default Scroll Time' or 'Enable Auto-Scroll to Current Time' settings) whenever the calendar view or date range changes. If unchecked, the calendar will attempt to remember your last scroll position.
label: scrollTimeReset

name: custom_slotduration
description: Defines the granularity of time slots displayed in Week and Day views (e.g., 00:15:00 for 15-minute slots)
label: slotDuration

name: custom_slotlabelinterval
description: Sets the interval for time labels displayed on the left axis in Week and Day views (e.g., 01:00:00 for every hour)
label: SlotLabelInterval

name: custom_slotmintime
description: Specifies the earliest time displayed in Week and Day calendar views. This sets the initial topmost time slot shown, even when the calendar is scrolled to its earliest point (e.g., 08:00:00 for an 8 AM start)
label: slotMinTime

name: custom_slotmaxtime
description: Sets the latest time displayed in Week and Day views. This defines the final visible time slot at the bottom of the calendar (e.g., 18:00:00 to end the calendar day at 6 PM)
label: slotMaxTime

name: custom_filters
description: Please do not leave this field empty — it will cause an error. If you have no value to enter, use ‘[]’ instead.
label: JSON Filters
